definition:
Let $\mathbb{F}$ be a field, and let
$m, n \in \mathbb{N} \setminus \{0\}.$ Consider an $m \times n$ matrix
$A$ whose entries belong to $\mathbb{F}.$ Let
$\displaystyle C_1, \ldots , C_n \in \mathbb{F}^m$ be the columns of
$A.$

The spark of the matrix $A$ is defined to be the infimum of the set of
all positive integers $k$ with the property that $$ j\_1, …, j\_k {1, …,
n} : {

[l]{} j\_1 < …< j\_k,\
$\displaystyle C_{j_1}, \ldots , C_{j_k}$ are linearly dependent (over
$\mathbb{F}$).

. $$

The notion of spark of a matrix was introduced by Donoho and Elad in
[@de]. It is strictly related to Compressed Sensing. The word “spark”
comes from a verbal fusion of “sparse” and “rank”.

The following properties hold true:\

  ------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    (i)   ${\rm spark} (A) \in \{1, \ldots , n\} \cup \{+\infty\},$
   (ii)   ${\rm spark} (A) = +\infty\, \Leftrightarrow\, {\rm rank} (A) = n,$
   (iii)  ${\rm spark} (A) = 1$ if and only if the matrix $A$ has a zero column,
   (iv)   if ${\rm spark} (A) \neq +\infty,$ then ${\rm spark} (A) \leq {\rm rank} (A) + 1.$
  ------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

\
Moreover, ${\rm spark} (A)$ coincides with the infimum of the set
$\displaystyle \left\{\left\| x \right\|_0 :\, x \in \mathbb{F}^n \setminus \{{\bf 0}\},\, A x = {\bf 0}\right\}$,
where $\displaystyle \left\| x \right\|_0$ is the Hamming weight of $x$
and ${\bf 0}$ stands for the appropriate zero vectors.

[99]{} D. L. Donoho and M. Elad, Optimally sparse representation in
general (nonorthogonal) dictionaries via $\ell^1$ minimization, [*Proc.
Natl. Acad. Sci. USA*]{} [**100**]{}, No. 5: 2197 – 2202 (2003).
